entry.title: Azerbaijan creating ‚Äòartificial obstacles‚Äô to normalization deal, Armenia charges

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan creating ‚Äòartificial obstacles‚Äô to normalization deal, Armenia charges
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs top diplomat accused Azerbaijan of creating ‚Äúnew artificial obstacles‚Äù as yearslong efforts to reach a normalization deal appear to remain stalled. üìç Armenia will receive nearly $11 million in military aid from the European Union after Hungary lifted its veto, Radio Azatutyun reported, citing unnamed diplomatic sources. üìç Armenia‚Äôs prime minister said he ‚Äúgreatly values the role of the United States in the peace-building process in our region‚Äù in a July 4 letter to the U.S. president. üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T_ys80vOdII üìç Renowned historian Ronald Grigor Suny on ‚ÄúPashinyan‚Äôs ruthless dilemma:‚Äù https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bc7NLr7caTI
Credits: Ruptly

media:group.media:title: Who lost Artsakh?
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian analyzes Secretary of Armenia's National Security Council‚Äôs comments last week regarding the challenges Armenia faced last year. He also takes an in-depth look at what factors led to the ethnic cleansing of Artsakh and the widespread displacement of Armenians. Furthermore, Hacopian helps apportion responsibility for the outcome to key players and outlines reforms to prevent future issues.

entry.title: Uncertainties mount in bordering Kirants amid border demarcation

media:group.media:title: Uncertainties mount in bordering Kirants amid border demarcation
media:group.media:description:
After a period of anti-government protests in Armenia‚Äôs Tavush region, the sound of border construction is now heard again. In May, residents in Kirants village, bordering Azerbaijan, took to the streets to protest Yerevan‚Äôs border delimitation and demarcation process, which includes the handing over of vital roads, bridges, and farmland to Azerbaijan. The demarcation has already split part of Kirants village and has led to the evacuation of a number of residents. CivilNet is in the region to understand the impact of this process on people.

entry.title: Armenia in ‚Äòsubstantive‚Äô talks with US to replace aging nuclear plant

media:group.media:title: Armenia in ‚Äòsubstantive‚Äô talks with US to replace aging nuclear plant
media:group.media:description:
üìç It remains unclear if the top diplomats of Armenia and Azerbaijan will hold another round of talks on the sidelines of next week‚Äôs NATO summit in Washington. üìç Security chief Armen Grigoryan indicated that Armenia plans to pivot away from Russia to the United States as it seeks a replacement for its aging nuclear power plant. üìç Armenia opened a criminal probe on suspicion of incitement to suicide after one service member died of a gunshot wound overnight, the country‚Äôs latest non-combat army death. üìç A bipartisan congressional delegation arrived in Yerevan from Washington for talks with Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and other senior Armenian officials.

entry.title: Pashinyan's Ruthless Dilemma: A Talk With Ronald Suny

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan's Ruthless Dilemma: A Talk With Ronald Suny
media:group.media:description:
Ronald Grigor Suny, Distinguished University Professor of History at the University of Michigan, Emeritus Professor of Political Science and History at the University of Chicago, and Senior Researcher at the National Research University ‚Äì Higher School of Economics in Saint Petersburg, Russia, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Eric Hacopian to talk about Armenia‚Äôs domestic and regional challenges.
Professor Suny holds Russia responsible for betraying Armenia during the ethnic cleansing of Nagorno-Karabakh in 2023, and criticizes the U.S. for not taking practical steps to prevent autocratic Azerbaijan‚Äôs aggression against the democratic Armenian enclave.

entry.title: CivilNet becomes first Armenian news site to join Meta‚Äôs third-party fact-checking program

media:group.media:title: CivilNet becomes first Armenian news site to join Meta‚Äôs third-party fact-checking program
media:group.media:description:
üìç Azerbaijan‚Äôs president said he believes his country can reach a normalization deal with Armenia ‚Äúwithin several months,‚Äù while the U.S. secretary of state said he believes a peace deal between Yerevan and Baku remains ‚Äúachievable‚Äù and ‚Äúwithin reach.‚Äù üìç Freedom House found Azerbaijan‚Äôs actions in Nagorno-Karabakh since 2020 amounted to ethnic cleansing and urged the International Criminal Court to open an investigation. üìç An overhauled version of Armenia‚Äôs domestic violence law went into effect, a move that women‚Äôs rights advocates welcomed as historic. Read more: https://shorturl.at/yXDrv üìç CivilNet became the first Armenian news organization to join Meta‚Äôs expanding third-party fact-checking program. Read more: https://shorturl.at/DtbTl
